revised_title: Investigation on the Transmission of Sound by the Atmosphere
tldr: This article discusses an investigation on the transmission of sound through the atmosphere, focusing on fog signals and the effectiveness of various instruments such as trumpets, steam whistles, guns, and a steam siren. The author found that the acoustic transparency of the atmosphere varies greatly and can be affected by factors such as weather conditions and the presence of water vapor. The study also highlights the importance of understanding the relationship between optical and acoustic transparency.
